text:
A plea to strictly enforce the ban on the use of plastic has been made by Thanneer, a non-governmental organisation. In a petition to K. S. Palanisamy, District Collector, here on Monday, K.C. Neelamegam, secretary of the Thanneer, said that much had been said about the hazards of plastics. He said that the ban on the use of plastics should be enforced. More than the consumers, it is the shopkeepers who used plastic bags as part of their customer service. He said that strict action should be taken against those flouting the ban.

Noon meal workers

seek Pongal bonus

Members of the district wing of the Tamil Nadu Retired Nutritious Meal and Anganwadi Workers Association, have urged the State government to sanction ‘Pongal’ bonus of Rs.500 to them. In a petition submitted to the Chief Minister through the District Collector, K.S. Palanisamy here on Monday, S. Thangavel, District president of the association, said the ‘Pongal’ bonus was a felt need of the retired employees.

Farmers seek

insurance

A section of farmers from Andanallur union has urged the Cooperation Department to sanction compensation to paddy farmers under the crop insurance scheme. In a release here on Monday, O. Nadarajan, president of the Andanallur union wing of the Tamizhnadu Vivasayigal Sangam, said that although the cooperative societies had recovered insurance premium from the borrowers, there was delay in sanctioning compensation who had incurred serious loss during the drought-prone conditions in the recent years.
title: NGO pleads for ban on plastic
